overview: From 2025-09-26 to 2025-09-27, elizaos/eliza had 5 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat(server): auto-install missing plugins in PluginLoader
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This PR introduces safe, on-demand plugin auto-installation for the server PluginLoader.

Problem
- Missing server plugins cause runtime failures when a project references external plugins not pre-installed.
- Operators often need to manually run `bun add <package>` after the runtime crashes.

Solution
- Add `PluginInstaller` which guards via environment checks (disabled in CI/test, opt-out via `ELIZA_NO_AUTO_INSTALL`, `ELIZA_NO_PLUGIN_AUTO_INSTALL`).
- On import failure, attempt `bun add <plugin>` once per process, then retry import.
- Uses Bun subprocess to avoid Node-only assumptions; logs clearly on failure without crashing.

Files Changed
- `packages/server/src/managers/PluginLoader.ts`: Integrate auto-install retry path.
- `packages/server/src/managers/PluginInstaller.ts`: New installer with guards and single-attempt tracking.
- `bun.lock`: Updated due to added dependencies.

Risk & Mitigation
- Auto-install is disabled in test/CI and behind env guards.
- Only triggers on precise missing-module errors; otherwise no behavior change.

Testing
- Local: remove a plugin, start server, observe auto-install and successful import.
- CI: assert no auto-install attempts when `CI=true`.

Follow-ups
- Consider surfacing a CLI prompt or server setting to confirm auto-install in interactive environments.

topPRs.title: fix: .env not loading from mono, ollama always fallback
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
Refines the logic for including Ollama as a fallback LLM provider,
ensuring it's only included when no other LLM providers are configured.

Enhances environment variable loading by using a monorepo-aware
resolver, falling back to the current working directory if resolution
fails. This ensures that the root .env file is found when running via
turbo.

topPRs.title: Fix(runtime): Ensure agent creation handles missing agent gracefully
topPRs.author: digitalsimboja
topPRs.body:
Fixes #6003

Relates to

Fixes runtime crash when getAgent() fails due to missing agents table or undefined character.id.

Risks

Low – affects only agent initialization during startup.

Background

AgentRuntime previously crashed if the agents table was missing or if no agent record was found. This PR ensures runtime startup by handling errors gracefully and creating the agent when necessary.

What does this PR do?

Wraps getAgent() in try/catch.

Falls back to createAgent() if no agent exists.

Logs clear error if character.id is missing.

Type of change

Bug fix – non-breaking, improves startup resilience.

Testing

Start runtime with a new Postgres DB (no agents table).

Start runtime with character config missing id.

Verify runtime does not crash and agent is created or error is logged clearly.

topPRs.title: fix: initialize runtimes with settings at creation
topPRs.author: tcm390
topPRs.body: issue: Settings are injected after runtime initialization, which causes a race condition where the adapter does not receive the correct Postgres URL from the environment. As a result, the adapter fails to be created, leading to failed DB operations and ultimately crashing the app. https://linear.app/eliza-labs/issue/ELIZA-741/unhandled-exception-when-getagents-fails-in-runtimets-missing-agents - core: add RuntimeSettings import and accept `settings` in `ElizaOS.addAgents` - core: pass `settings` into `AgentRuntime` constructor during agent creation - server: load env settings once and pass to `addAgents` - server: remove post-creation runtime mutation via Object.assign(settings) This ensures runtimes and plugins receive configuration during initialization, avoiding late mutations and potential race conditions.
